result.execSummary:
The defendant Alicia E Thunder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alicia E Thunder in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Defendant Alicia E Thunder in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:02 PM. Called 15CM10, 15CM143, 16CF155, 16TR418 and 16TR417. Ferguson - on 16CF155 - dismiss and read in counts #1 and #2, count #3 - plead G as alleged with joint recommendation of a fine of $500 plus costs and surcharges, count #4 - plead G as alleged - joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: free to argue jail time, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no posession oof alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or Class B establishments, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community service, both traffic citations will be dismissed. State agrees. Court dismisses and reads in counts #1 and #2 on 16CF155 and dismisses 16TR417 and 16TR418. Thunder pleads G to counts #3 and #4 on 16CF155. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State asks if the sentencing after revocation hearings can be done at same time. Ferguson and Thunder agree. State - 15CM10 - 24 days credit, 15CM143 - 53 days credit, additional 110 days that can be applied to either case - has reviewed the revocation summary packet - recommends court apply the 134 days credit to 15CM110 and 163 days credit to 15CM143 and give her credit for time served and run concurrent to each other, State makes final argument prior to sentencing  - follow joint recommendation on count #3, follow joint recommendation on count #4 and recommends 180 in jail commencing today and probation on new case commencing today. Ferguson has slightly different amounts for credit, has 136 days credit on 15CM10 and 184 days on 15CM143 - counting today towards those credit amounts. State would be willing to stipulate to those amounts. Ferguson makes final argument prior to sentencing - 15CM10 - ask for time served (135 days), on 15CM143 - ask for time served (183 days credit), 16CF155 - follow joint recommendation on count #3, follow joint recommendation on count #4 - recommends the Court impose 90 days of jail, stay all but 30 days of it and make that stay contingent upon her completing an inpatient treatment program. Thunder makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CM10 - 135 days in FC jail - 165 dyas creidt, 15CM143 - 183 days in jail - credit for 183 days; count #3 - #500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - 60 DTP upon release from custody on count #4/CO; count #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no posession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or Class B establishments, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, submit DNA sample with expunction right given, costs on count #4 - 60 DTP upon release from custody/CO, 120 days in FC jail - stay 60 days and if complete an inpatient treatment program within the first year of probation - 60 stayed jail time will remain stayed unless conditions of probation are violated - begin jail time today - huber allowed, no additional credit on this case, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
email from court to Atty Ferguson
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 24, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alicia E Thunder in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:31 PM. Also called 14TR727, 15CM10 and 15CM143. Ferguson - 15CM143 is set for AIA but have reached a global agreement on all matters. Ferguson - dismiss 14TR727, 15CM01 - dismiss only count, 15CM10 - plead NC to only count as alleged with joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 18 months with conditions of: pay court costs, AODA and follow thru, anger management assessment and follow thru, absolute sobriety and no entry into any bars or taverns and no possession of alcohol, employment/school, 50 hours of community service.  State - restitution demand of $275.00 to DOC plus $27.50 VW surcharge totalling $302.50; 15CM143 - plead to count #2 as alleged and same sentence as previous probation with same conditions except no additional community service, DRI remaining counts. State and Thunder agree. Court dismisses 15TR147 and dismisses and reads in counts #1 and #3 on 15CM143 and dismisses 15CM01. Thunder pleads NC to other counts as previously stated. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing, follow joint recommendation. Ferguson makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Thunder makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CM10 - count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months with conditions of: pay court costs - take bond posted, AODA and follow thru, anger management assessment and follow thru, absolute sobriety and no entry into any bars or taverns and no possession of alcohol, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 50 hours of community service, restitution of $302.50 including VW surcharge - take bond posted; 15CM143 - count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months - concurrent to 15CM10, with same conditions except no additional community service or restitution, court costs - take bond posted, of: pay court costs - take bond posted, AODA and follow thru, anger management assessment and follow thru, absolute sobriety and no entry into any bars or taverns and no possession of alcohol, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 50 hours of community service, restitution of $302.50 including VW surcharge - take bond posted - remainder due thru probation, submit DNA sample and gives expungement instructions regarding DNA, credit for 5 days on 15CM10 and 4 days credit on 15CM143 - only if revoked, right to appeal, adjourned.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alicia E Thunder in court, in custody and appears via video.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:48 AM. State - has filed complaint but defendant does not have a copy and will provide one to the jail to get to her. Court reads charges, penalties and right to attorney. Defendant indicates she has an attorney, Amy Furgeson and had informed her of today's proceedings but also has court tomorrow and may have been confused. Court indicates the proceedings taking place tommorrow are in front of Judge Bloom and suggests this case be heard with the other two cases. State does not object. Court sets for an adjourned inital and may see if Judge Bloom could hear this case and if not will have AIA date. Bond - State $500 cash, no consumption of alcohol. Court - sets $1000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol. State indicates that the other two cases were actually issued warrants due to non-appearance for PLEAS.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
